class_notes: JM Students only.  Per ABA rules, JD and LLM students will not receive credit for JM courses
course_description: In this course, students study the formation, financing, and management of the life cycle of business organizations. Students will consider a) business entity forms and formation (the solo to the partnership, to large corporate forms, to nonprofits and public benefit corporations); b) the life cycle of a business (starting, managing, and ending a business; mergers, acquisitions, franchises) and capitalizing business (forms of financing, and other modern financing opportunities).
sections: Class Nbr: 1163, Section #: 001, Type: LEC, Campus: ONLIN, Meets: Meets Online, Instructor: L. Jirak, Status: Open
